summary: This appears to be an email from July 19, 2019, regarding an 'AD order' (likely Administrative Detention or similar) for an individual, sent to a Captain and referencing the Department of Justice Federal Bureau of Prisons. The context suggests it is related to the detention or security status of a person, possibly Jeffrey Epstein, given the date proximity to his arrest and subsequent death in custody.

events.title: AD Order Issued
events.description: An email indicates that 'everyone has an AD order,' likely referring to an Administrative Detention or similar security order for an individual in custody.

locations.name: Department of Justice Federal Bureau of Prisons
locations.context: Location referenced in the email, likely a Bureau of Prisons facility or office.

keyFacts: The document is an email dated July 19, 2019, concerning an 'AD order' for an individual.
It is addressed to a 'Captain' and references the Department of Justice Federal Bureau of Prisons.
The email's date is significant as it falls between Jeffrey Epstein's arrest on July 6, 2019, and his death in custody on August 10, 2019, suggesting it may relate to his detention conditions.
